About Me: I am a 3rd year CS major at Georgia Tech and currently employed.
In my free time, I like making games and music.
Experience: Software Engineer Co-Op, Georgia Tech Research Institute (Fall 2019 -> Present)

Developed and maintained the back-end systems of an in-flight entertainment system for a major airline. Used Java and the Spring framework in combination with other web technologies, such as JSP and RabbitMQ.
Developed a native Android app to faciliate contactless dining in restaurants during the COVID-19 pandemic. Used Kotlin and Dagger.

Developed a cloud-enabled reverse vending machine to show how recycling could be incentivized on university campuses. The reverse vending machine was engineered and developed using Python and the OpenCV library, and the backend was powered by Google's Firebase.
Fun Facts: I got into programming by making Roblox games. At age 11, one of my games got onto the front page.
I am active in the open source Minecraft modding community.
